name: Cavas Wine Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Is it pricey? Yes. Is it worth every single penny? YES! If you love wine and want to treat yourself to the vacation of your life, go to Cavas. My spouse and I, along with two friends, went for 3 days last week. I can honestly say I have never experienced such incredible service anywhere I have stayed - ever. For every minute of your stay you are made to feel as though the staff *looks* for ways to make your stay better, and takes great personal pride in finding ways to impress.
reviews.title: It is not possible to say enough wonderful things about Cavas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me back up... are from Toronto and made a stay at Cavas part of an 11 day trip to Argentina. We purchased the 'special package' that included a private driver to wineries, all means, massage and transportation from/to the airport. We had prompt and frequent communication from the hotel while planning our trip, and they put together an entire itinerary for us (with our full participation) to ensure that our stay would be just what we wanted it to be. Despite numerous changes (from our end), each one was greeted with a friendly and helpful response. By the time we were leaving Toronto, I think we were on v.8, and we never once felt that we were a bother to the staff.
reviews.title: Awesome!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The surroundings are nothing short of breathtaking. You are on your own building (every single room has its own building) and all you see around you are grape vines and the (few) other buildings (and, on a clear day, a breathtaking view of the Andes). The rooms are huge, with your own sitting area, desk (wifi included), walk in closet and a bathroom larger than any in our house. Each room has its own 'plunge pool' out back in case you get too hot on your deck. Perhaps the best part is that you can go on the roof and just take in the view (or start a fire in your wood burning rooftop fireplace).
reviews.title: Expensive but worth every penny

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is terrific, and again if there's something you want that's not on the menu, they are happy to make it. The one drawback is that you really are out in wine country, so just 'walking into town' isn't an option. The hotel will certainly arrange for a driver, but you can't really wander around too much on your own. But for us, the whole point was to be in wine country, so it fit the bill perfectly.
reviews.title: Breathtaking Stay in the Vineyards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the food at the hotel really is very, very good, one highlight for us was going into town to eat at 1884, Mallman's restaurant. The steak was the best I had in Argentina (and given that we labelled this the 'red meat, red wine tour', that's saying something). Don't miss it if you have the chance to go.
reviews.title: Wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Cavas Lodge during our visit to the wine region of Mendoza.There are only 14 "casas" surrounded by the vineyard.The room is very specious,and includes a living room with a fireplace,bedroom and a huge bathroom with nice amenities. There is an our door shower and a small private pool and upstairs on the roof there is a cozy sitting area with another fireplace offering amazing views of the Andes.The staff was very accommodating and personal and the food was amazing.We enjoyed the complimentary wine tasting in the cellar ,which gave us a good overview of the different wine producers from various regions. Cavas lodge is part of the Relais & Chateaux and there for it is a very upscale property and the spa is very nice and relaxing.
reviews.title: upscale & unique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of our favorite hotels - I must say that leaving was pretty difficult. This place is heavenly - great for a romantic vacation and they plan EVERYTHING.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Mendoza - Incredible Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I am a big planner, and so I planned much of our trip before we arrived. When we got there, I realized I should have left to them. The hotel staff did a wonderful job adjusting winery visits to what we liked/disliked on previous days. Overall, service was seamless which was really incredible. To that end, I would highly recommend doing the all inclusive package if they offer it - it was well worth the extra cost.
reviews.title: Fantasic Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, if you go to Mendoza, regardless of where you stay, make sure you use MAURO as your wine tour driver/guide. He speaks multiple languages, is very professional and knows everything about the wineries there. Mendoza wine country can be difficult to navigate without someone like him. Additionally, he's very open and honest about his recommendations and steered us away from many wineries we may not have enjoyed and got us into other wineries (with the help of Cavas) that he thought we'd like better. I cannot say enough wonderful things about MAURO - he was with us for the whole trip and really made it 10x better. If you know where to go / what to try, you'll get some really great winery and dining experiences in Mendoza.
reviews.title: Heavenly hotel in the vines with view of the Andes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place to stay and wonderful service - we cannot wait to go back!
reviews.title: I wish I would have stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a superb stay at Cavas. We arrived around 9pm after an efficient transfer from the airport with a glass of their house wine and shown to a superb room with loads of space and tasteful furnishings. It is out in the wilds a bit but very secure in a very calm environment.
reviews.title: Superb in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we booked the hotel we selected an inclusive deal which included all meals both inside and outside the hotel, all transfers/drivers, activities etc. This was an excellent arrangement as it meant that we were able to decide to eat in or out, get driven to outside restaurants, and arrange whatever we wanted without having to negotiate prices or worry about making additional payments.
reviews.title: Fabulous Luxury -- Plan to Splurge & Not Watch Every Dime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at Cavas was very good, not a large selection each evening (unsurprisingly, given size of the hotel) but I'm sure it's the sort of place where if you have particular preferences or requirements they will arrange around that. I was at Cavas over my birthday and they offered dinner on our private terrace but as it was a bit chilly we ended up having a private dinner inside which was very special.
reviews.title: Worth the expense

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The views of the Andes from the hotel are excellent and the rooms are beautiful. Service was discreet but friendly and we felt a real warmth to the people that had looked after us.
reviews.title: Best place we have stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Cavas arranged wine tastings for us on one day, visiting three different wineries with lunch at one of them, and on our other day a (fairly strenuous) walk in the foothills of the Andes with a great picnic. I had a massage one day (also included in the price) which was a great massage but I didn't find the spa area as luxurious as I might have expected.
reviews.title: It (almost) just doesn't get better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cavas Wine Lodge is truly special. We have been fortunate to travel all over the world, and Cavas stands out as one of the best. The level of luxury in the rooms and everywhere on the property is excellent. The personal service is special without being intrusive. The spa services top notch. The view - unbelievable. We did the "special programme" all inclusive package and loved it. Everything we wanted to do was arranged. Horseback riding was a highlight, as well as the wineries. If you like luxury, but in a special setting, you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: An Exceptional Property in an Exceptional Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for three nights in December, it was the last leg of our 2.5 week trip to Argentina...what a way to end!! The property is absolutely stunning - from the rooms to the backyard/plunge pool in the vineyard to the rooftop terrace overlooking the Andes. The staff was exceptional and so helpful with our day trips, dinners and even packing our wine bottles for the flight home. I highly recommend staying here....you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: A Piece of Heaven on Earth.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: there are absolutely no words to describe the 5 nights we stayed at Cavas... at least none that would completely describe what an amazying experience we had there! Staff was just excepcional : kind, polite, treating all the guests by their names, always smiling and prompt to assist us in anything we needed (from special entertainment nights such as tango lessons to special packaging for all the wines we bought along our visit). Cecilia and Martin: thumbs up to both of you: excellent location, amazying food, superb staff and good bonarda! We loved it!
reviews.title: a hidden treasure in the middle of mendoza

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our recent stay at Cavas was simply amazing. The location and the view from the roof terrace was breathtaking, the staff were incredible and the food was delicious. Cavas exceeded our expectations and went further still. We cannot recommend more highly, particularly for a special occasion. We stayed in some beautiful hotels in Argentina but Cavas topped the lot. Thank you Cavas, especially Jessica for all your efforts and Martin for making our stay so unforgettable. We managed to get our Cavas wine glasses back to the UK all in one piece, via Bariloche, El Calafate, El Chalten, BA and Washington DC and we hope to enjoy plenty of Argentine wine from them.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived after a rather stressful trip from BA due to strikes, the staff at Cavas were incredible. Champagne in hand leaving luggage, admin etc to them they escorted us to our hut, and it only got better from there. The views are stunning with surrounding vineyards and Alps, the service impeccable, the food great and nothing is too much trouble. The huts have all mod cons but in keeping with a nice style, shower and bathroom amazing, and private terrace with your own fireplace... Well that says it all! It feels secluded and private too. Expensive? Yes. Would recommend package option which incudes absolutely everything - trips, food, travel etc - les hassle and seemed better value looking at non package options and costs adding up. Worth it? Totally. Would we go back? We wish!!
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing - place of a lifetime

description: The Cavas Wine Lodge is located amid the snow-capped Andes Mountains and the fertile, green vineyards of Mendoza. It is the fist hotel in Mendoza dedicated to wine and all its secrets. Guests are drawn to the Cavas Wine Lodge for its privacy, tranquility and unmistakable romance. Guests are encouraged to indulge in wine, food, luxurious spa treatments and the surrounding natural beauty.
